newsitem.title: LATVIA: Latvian Unibanka sees 1996 profit at 6 mln lats.
newsitem.headline: Latvian Unibanka sees 1996 profit at 6 mln lats.

text.p: Leading Latvian bank Unibanka on Friday said it estimated its 1996 profits at six million lats compared with a planned figure of 5.6 million lats.
Unibanka vice-president Maris Kirsons said profits for 1997 would be on the same level as those for last year.
He said the bank needed to find more profit sources as making money from government Treasury bills no longer provided the same size of income as previously.
"It will be more difficult to achieve that (the planned 1997 profit) since interest rates have gone down," Kirsons told a news conference.
"We will have to orient ourselves to more sophisticated services, earning commission rather than interest," he added.
Many Baltic banks earned big revenues from government Treasury bills but yields have been gradually falling and are now under 10 percent in all maturities in Latvia.
Kirsons said the bank's assets grew to 158 million lats by the end of 1996 from 115.80 million lats at the end of 1995.
Kirsons said that as part of the bank's diversification policy, the bank planned to reach non-interest income levels of 31 percent in 1997 versus 24.5 percent in 1996.
He said full audited results were due on February 24.
